Articles.Content:
Create an orbit that enters Kearth, literally.

Not uh, sure how I did it. But I challenge you to. Because I bet you can\'t. I\'mmaboss, the end.

Oh and please note the crewmember\'s face of solemn confusion.
Impossible. There\'s no such thing as Kearth. only Kerbin!

Are you referring only to the orbit projection, or did your ship actually go through the planet? Because if not, then you create through-planet orbit paths every time you launch before you reach orbital velocity.

In the fourth image, that is the ship within kearth (kerbin, sorry nova. btw I really like your stuff. keep on keeping on.)

But I literally had a negative number on my altimeter. I want to see negatives.

In the fourth image, that is the ship within kearth (kerbin, sorry nova. btw I really like your stuff. keep on keeping on.)

But I literally had a negative number on my altimeter. I want to see negatives.

It\'s a bug in 0.12 x1, fixed now. I can easily do it, just time warp though kerbin, and even though it says the speed goes down, it doesn\'t actually go off rails.

I can easily do it, just time warp though kerbin, and even though it says the speed goes down, it doesn\'t actually go off rails.

Yeah bro. Screenshots. This is a challenge.

Impossible. There\'s no such thing as Kearth. only Kerbin!

Lol. This always gets Nova in a bad mood. xD
